page.title: 01VALE OF GLAMORGAN AREA
page.content: The area covered by this part of the survey is within 10 miles of the City of{Cardiff}between 2 major roads and yet it retains a very{rural}atmosphere with narrow country lanes and very few ammenities. It can be inferred from looking at the area as a whole thatto live in this area without access to transport with or without a family,young or old would be very difficult. The major part of this area to the west is dominated by{Dyffryn {House}and grounds. This complex is under threat of closure due to cutbacks in local government spending and as it was bequeathed to{Glamorgan} as a whole is affected by 3 separate counties' financial difficulties. The eastern fringe, by contrast, has been altered slightly more by the latter half of the 20th century (golf club and quarries).
